alert.note: Alert for Big Island Interior; Central Oahu; Kauai Leeward; Kohala; Kona; Lanai Makai; Lanai Mauka; Leeward Haleakala; Maui Central Valley; Maui Leeward West; Molokai Leeward; Niihau; Oahu Koolau; Oahu North Shore; Oahu South Shore; South Big Island; Waianae Coast; Waianae Mountains (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued November 04 at 3:15PM HST until November 06 at 6:00PM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING FROM SUNDAY MORNING THROUGH MONDAY AFTERNOON FOR LEEWARD AREAS OF ALL ISLANDS AND FOR CENTRAL OAHU DUE TO STRONG TRADE WINDS AND LOW HUMIDITY... .Strong trade winds and low relative humidity will combine with dry fuels to bring the potential for critical fire weather conditions from late Sunday morning through Monday afternoon. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM SUNDAY TO 6 PM HST MONDAY FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY... The National Weather Service in Honolulu has issued a Red Flag Warning for wind and low relative humidity, which is in effect from 10 AM Sunday to 6 PM HST Monday. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect. * AFFECTED AREA...Leeward areas of all Hawaiian Islands, and central Oahu. On Kauai, this also includes south shore areas such as Koloa, Poipu and Mahaulepu. * TIMING...From 10 AM Sunday to 6 PM HST Monday, with relative humidity reaching its lowest during the afternoon hours. * WINDS...East 15 to 30 mph. Gusts up to 50 mph. Winds are expected to reach their peak on Monday. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 40 percent. * IMPACTS...A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and dry fuels will contribute to extreme fire behavior. Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. It is important to remember that a Red Flag Warning does not predict new fire starts. For actions you can take to protect life and property from wildfires, visit the Hawaii Wildfire Management Organization at https://www.hawaiiwildfire.org/home
info.instruction: Outdoor burning is not recommended. Heat from vehicle exhaust systems can ignite dry grass. Park cars on areas that are paved or where vegetation is trimmed and cleared. High winds contribute to wildfire hazard. Delay activities that could throw off sparks until the wind dies down. A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now or will shortly.
